{"step_by_step_thinking": "The lateral pharyngeal space is a deep space in the neck. According to Document [11], it communicates with the buccal space anteriorly and the submandibular space medially. Document [14] also mentions that the submandibular space communicates inferiorly to the lateral pharyngeal space. However, there is no direct mention of the lateral pharyngeal space communicating with the sublingual space or the retropharyngeal space. But, the retropharyngeal space is a deep space in the neck that is located posterior to the pharynx, which makes it likely to communicate with the lateral pharyngeal space. On the other hand, the sublingual space is located in the mouth, above the tongue, which makes it less likely to communicate directly with the lateral pharyngeal space.", "answer_choice": "B"}
